alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Canadian (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 8:38AM CDT until July 08 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Watonga affecting Canadian and Blaine Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Watonga. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, near bankfull conditions exist along the river may occur. The river reach affected extends from near Watonga in Blaine County... downstream to near Calumet in western Canadian County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 13.1 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
